item.title: Buy command from pork pl0x and adu modification
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

Thanks to Adu’s help, I have found this to work. I have also modified it to notify when an item is not allowed to be bought. I also cleaned it so that the text has spaces in it where it says you bought the item.

[code] if(cmd.equals(“buy”)) {
if(player.getLocation().inWilderness()){
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“Cannot use ::buy in wilderness”);
return;
}
if(args.length < 1 || args.length > 2) {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“Invalid args. Syntax: BUY id [amount]”);
return;
}
int id = Integer.parseInt(args[0]);
int amount = 1;
int [] ids = { 545, 546 };
for (int i = 0;i < ids.length;i++ ){
if (ids[i] == id) {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“Sorry, you cannot buy that item.”);
return;
}
}
if(args.length == 2 && EntityHandler.getItemDef(id).isStackable()) {
amount = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
}
if(amount <= 0){
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“Invalid amount”);
return;
}
if(player.getInventory().countId(10) < EntityHandler.getItemDef(id).getBasePrice() * amount) {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“You don’t have enough money to buy this!”);
return;
}
else {

			InvItem item = new InvItem(id, amount);
				player.getInventory().remove(10, (EntityHandler.getItemDef(id).getBasePrice() * amount));
				player.getInventory().add(item);
				player.getActionSender().sendInventory();
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You have just purchased " + amount +" "+ item.getDef().getName() + "(s)");
				}
			return;
	}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Buy command from pork pl0x and adu modification
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

darscape:

Yeah, thats what I was thinking. Problem is I’m not sure what to use for the array because I’m a newb at Java still.

Well, the best way would be to start by defining your array of ints

int [] ids = { 545, 546 };

This is array of two ints contaning id 545,546

Next you would need to check if the inputed id that the player enters is in the array, if its not, you would not be able to buy it.

for (int i = 0;i < ids.length;i++ ){ if (ids[i] != id) { return; } }

You can also change it up by having every non-buyable item in the array and do if (ids[i] == id)

Read full topic

item.title: Buy command from pork pl0x and adu modification
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

Buy command from pork pl0x and adu

[code]if(cmd.equals(“buy”)) {
if(player.getLocation().inWilderness()){
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“Cannot use ::buy in wilderness”);
return;
}
if(args.length < 1 || args.length > 2) {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“Invalid args. Syntax: BUY id [amount]”);
return;
}
int id = Integer.parseInt(args[0]);
int amount = 1;

	 		if(args.length == 2 && EntityHandler.getItemDef(id).isStackable()) {
					amount = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
			}
			if(amount <= 0){
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Invalid amount");
				return;
			}
			if(player.getInventory().countId(10) < EntityHandler.getItemDef(id).getBasePrice() * amount) {
					player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You don't have enough money to buy this!");
					return;
			}
			else {
			
			InvItem item = new InvItem(id, amount);
				player.getInventory().remove(10, (EntityHandler.getItemDef(id).getBasePrice() * amount));
				player.getInventory().add(item);
				player.getActionSender().sendInventory();
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You have just purchased" + amount + item.getDef().getName() + "(s)");
				}
			return;
	}	[/code]

I need to create a black list of item numbers ItemDef(id) so that they cannot be spawned so regular players can use this. Ideas?
